result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John E. Black

1:09 PM
Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Erin Preston. Clerk JT  Minutes: Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:45 am. Bond continued as previously set. ec
Preliminary hearing on November 8, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Defendant John E. Black not in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for John E. Black.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: Attorney Preston is unsure if DE received the Notice of Hearing from her on date change. STC date of 10/19/2022 at 1:00pm is put back on the calendar. Bond continued.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
at the request of Atty Preston the STC is rescheduled to Prelim hearing date of 09-30-22 at 8:30am Intake.  DA notified.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, John E. Black, appeared.  Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:   DE does not appear court issues BWAR for $1000 cash.  

DE appears late.  Court vacates bench warrant authorized earlier.     SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Walmart Kenosha Co. Jay G.

01:08 PM    Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Zachary Caley.   Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 9/6/22 @915AM. $500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). EC
and witness list filed by the State
